div.l: While thou hast as a Coward be agast
Ye fals harlot quod the Millere hast
A fals traitoure fals Clerke heqduodheqduod he
Thou shalte be dede by goddis dignyte
Who durst be so bolde to disꝑparage
My doughtʳur that is com̄ of suche lynage
And by the throte bolle he caught Alyen̄
And he hente hym̄ dispitously ageyn̄
And on̄ the nose he smote hym̄ with his fest
That doun̄ ran̄ the blode streme vppon̄ his brest
And in the flore with nose and mouthe broke
They walwyn̄ as don̄ · ijᵒ · pigges in a poke
And vp̄ they gon̄ and doun̄ ayen̄ anon̄
Till that Millere spurned at aston̄
A doun̄ he fele bakward on̄ his wif
That wist nothyng of this nyce strif
For she was fall a slepe alitle wight
With Iohn the Clerke that wakid hadde all nyght
And with the fall oute of hure slepe she braide
Helpe holy Crosse of Bromholm̄ she saide
In manus tuas · lorde to the y calle
Awake Symkyn̄ the fende is onomon me falle
Myn̄ herte is brokyn̄ helpe y am̄ but dede
There lieth on̄ vppon̄ my wombe and on̄ my hede
Helpe Symkyn̄ for the falce Clerkis fight
This Iohn sterte vp̄ as fast as eủere he might
And gropith by the walles to and fro
To fynde a staff and she starte vp̄ also
And knewe the Estres bet than̄ did Iohn
And by the wall she founde a staf anon̄
And saugh a litle glemeryng of a light
For at an̄ hole yn̄ shone the mone bright
And by that light she sawe them̄ bothe two
But syker she nyst who was who
But as she sawe a white thyng in here ye
And when̄ she gan̄ this white thynge espye
She wende the Clerke had wered a volupere
And with the staff she drowe ay nere and nere
And wende haue hit this Aleyn̄ at the fulle
And smote the Miller even̄ vppon̄ the pilled sculle
